head.title: World Briefing | Americas: Venezuela: U.S. Envoy Says Bags Are Packed

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Americas: Venezuela: U.S. Envoy Says Bags Are Packed

abstract.p: Diplomatic relations between US and Venezuela appear to become more fragile as US Amb William Brownfield, responding to threat of expulsion from Pres Hugo Chavez, says that his bags are always packed and ready (S)

block.p: Diplomatic relations with the United States appeared to become more fragile as William Brownfield, the American ambassador, responded to a threat of expulsion from President Hugo Ch치vez by saying, ''My bags are always packed and ready.'' Mr. Brownfield, in a visit to Maracaibo, also emphasized that he hoped to avoid further confrontation and to focus instead on issues of political and economic importance to both Caracas and Washington. Mr. Ch치vez, who has threatened to expel Mr. Brownfield before, said on Thursday night that he could declare the ambassador ''persona non grata'' if he continued to comment on such issues as Venezuela's plan to nationalize companies controlled by foreign investors.
